<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="sys_properties"><sys_properties action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><choices/><description>CSS used to style the "Result" HTML in "x_1397355_s_speed_test_result" records</description><ignore_cache>true</ignore_cache><is_private>false</is_private><name>x_1397355_s_speed.result.style</name><read_roles/><suffix>result.style</suffix><sys_class_name>sys_properties</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>nik-admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2024-05-12 18:27:17</sys_created_on><sys_id>c7ab4f76474e4210edd8b4b4116d4323</sys_id><sys_mod_count>4</sys_mod_count><sys_name>x_1397355_s_speed.result.style</sys_name><sys_package display_value="Script Speed Tester" source="x_1397355_s_speed">9e1b559e47310210edd8b4b4116d4307</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="Script Speed Tester">9e1b559e47310210edd8b4b4116d4307</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sys_properties_c7ab4f76474e4210edd8b4b4116d4323</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>nik-admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2024-05-12 19:28:51</sys_updated_on><type>string</type><value><style>
    container {
        text-align: left; /* Align all content left */
    }

    #results_table {
        padding: 10px; /* Add padding to the table */
        border-collapse: collapse; /* Collapse borders to ensure continuous lines */
        margin: 0; /* Align the table to the left */
        width: auto; /* Make the table width adjust to content */
    }

    #results_table th {
        background-color: lightgrey; /* Light grey background for column headers */
        font-weight: bold; /* Bold font weight for column headers */
    }

    #results_table th,
    #results_table td {
        border: 1px solid black; /* Add border with continuous black lines */
        padding: 8px; /* Add padding to table cells */
    }

    .script {
        background-color: #f4f4f4; /* Light grey background for code blocks */
        padding: 10px; /* Add padding to code blocks */
        border: 1px solid #ddd; /* Add border */
        white-space: pre-wrap; /* Preserve white spaces and wrap lines */
        overflow-x: auto; /* Enable horizontal scroll if needed */
    }

    .script_name {
        font-weight: bold; /* Bold font weight for script names */
    }
</style></value><write_roles/></sys_properties><sys_translated_text action="delete_multiple" query="documentkey=c7ab4f76474e4210edd8b4b4116d4323"/></record_update>

sys_update_xml.name: sys_ui_page_efcecd5747924210edd8b4b4116d43c3
sys_update_xml.payload:
homepagesfalsex_1397355_s_speed_about_speed_tester.do
About Script Speed Tester
The application aims at measuring how long does the particular script execute. It also has the ability to compare the speed of up to 9 scripts. The tool is useful for optimising the run time of scripts when using them in ServiceNow.
Create a test definition in$[SP]x_1397355_s_speed_test_definition$[SP]table. Put in your scripts, set other details and run. Flow executes the scripts in background using the$[SP]GlideScopedEvaluator API. The test results are saved as$[SP]x_1397355_s_speed_test_result$[SP]records.

Roles:
x_1397355_s_speed.admin - application admin
x_1397355_s_speed.user - can read the test definitions, run tests and read results


Contributors
Natalia Kasper$[SP][LinkedIn]

sys_update_xml.name: sys_script_include_fcff29da47b10210edd8b4b4116d43fe
sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="sys_script_include"><sys_script_include action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><access>package_private</access><active>true</active><api_name>x_1397355_s_speed.ScriptSpeedExecution</api_name><caller_access/><client_callable>false</client_callable><description>Class to call on each script execution </description><name>ScriptSpeedExecution</name><script><![CDATA[var ScriptSpeedExecution = Class.create();
ScriptSpeedExecution.prototype = {
    initialize: function(iterations, script_field_name, script_name) {
        try {
            // Check if `iterations`, `script_field_name` and `script_name` parameters are provided
            if (typeof iterations === 'undefined') {
                throw 'Missing `iterations` parameter for initializing ScriptSpeedExecution';
            }

            if (typeof script_field_name === 'undefined') {
                throw 'Missing `script_field_name` parameter for initializing ScriptSpeedExecution';
            }

            if (typeof script_name === 'undefined') {
                throw 'Missing `script_name` parameter for initializing ScriptSpeedExecution';
            }

            this.iterations = iterations;
            this.execution_time_per_iteration = []; // Array to keep execution time of every iteration
            this.timer_start_time, this.timer_end_time, this.elapsed_time_MS = null; // Initialize timer variables with null value
            this.script_field_name = script_field_name;
            this.script_name = script_name;
        } catch (err) {
            throw 'Failed to initialize ScriptSpeedExecution:\n' + err;
        }
    },

    //Return array of execution time per iteration
    get_execution_time_per_iteration: function() {
        return this.execution_time_per_iteration.toString();
    },

    //Return total execution time of all iterations
    get_total_elapsed_time: function() {
        return this.execution_time_per_iteration.reduce(function(acc, val) {
            return acc + val;
        }, 0);
    },

    //Return average execution time per iteration
    get_average: function() {
        return this.get_total_elapsed_time() / this.iterations;
    },

    //Return max execution time
    get_max: function() {
        return this.execution_time_per_iteration.reduce(function(a, b) {
            return Math.max(a, b);
        });
    },

    //Return min execution time
    get_min: function() {
        return this.execution_time_per_iteration.reduce(function(a, b) {
            return Math.min(a, b);
        });
    },

    type: 'ScriptSpeedExecution'
};]]></script><sys_class_name>sys_script_include</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>nik-admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2024-04-28 12:36:51</sys_created_on><sys_id>fcff29da47b10210edd8b4b4116d43fe</sys_id><sys_mod_count>19</sys_mod_count><sys_name>ScriptSpeedExecution</sys_name><sys_package display_value="Script Speed Tester" source="x_1397355_s_speed">9e1b559e47310210edd8b4b4116d4307</sys_package><sys_policy>read</sys_policy><sys_scope display_value="Script Speed Tester">9e1b559e47310210edd8b4b4116d4307</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sys_script_include_fcff29da47b10210edd8b4b4116d43fe</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>nik-admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2024-05-08 19:35:18</sys_updated_on></sys_script_include></record_update>

sys_update_xml.name: sys_metadata_link_b347b58747520210edd8b4b4116d4308
sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="sys_metadata_link"><sys_metadata_link action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><directory>update</directory><documentkey>4f7de90747120210edd8b4b4116d433c</documentkey><payload><?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="x_1397355_s_speed_test_definition">
    <x_1397355_s_speed_test_definition action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE">
        <description>Compare speeds when doing GR queries in loop or separately. </description>
        <error/>
        <iterations>50</iterations>
        <last_run_by/>
        <last_succesful_run/>
        <last_test_result/>
        <name>Demo: GR speed comparison</name>
        <number_of_scripts>3</number_of_scripts>
        <script_1><![CDATA[success = (function() {
    try {
        // Write your script between START and END, do not change anything else
        // START
        var users_who_are_not_callers = [];

        // Query all users
        var user_gr = new GlideRecord('sys_user');
        user_gr.query();
        while (user_gr.next()) {
            // For each user check if they've opened an incident
            var caller_incident_gr = new GlideRecord('incident');
            caller_incident_gr.addNotNullQuery('caller_id');
            caller_incident_gr.addQuery('caller_id', user_gr.getUniqueValue());
            caller_incident_gr.setLimit(1);
            caller_incident_gr.query();
            if (!caller_incident_gr.hasNext()) {
                users_who_are_not_callers.push(user_gr.getUniqueValue());
            }
        }

		gs.info('[GR in nested loop] users_who_are_not_callers amount: ' + users_who_are_not_callers.length);

        // END
        return true;
    } catch (ex) {
        return false;
    }
})();]]></script_1>
        <script_2><![CDATA[success = (function() {
    try {
        // Write your script between START and END, do not change anything else
        // START

		// Collect the users and callers of incidents in separate GRs
        var users_who_are_not_callers = [];
        var users = {};
        var callers = {};

        var user_gr = new GlideRecord('sys_user');
        user_gr.query();
        while (user_gr.next()) {
            users[user_gr.getUniqueValue()] = true;
        }

        var caller_incident_gr = new GlideRecord('incident');
        caller_incident_gr.addNotNullQuery('caller_id');
        caller_incident_gr.query();
        while (caller_incident_gr.next()) {
            callers[caller_incident_gr.getValue('caller_id')] = true;
        }

        // Loop through the users and check against the incidents
        for (user in users) {
            if (!callers.hasOwnProperty(user)) {
                users_who_are_not_callers.push(user);
            }
        }

        gs.info('[GR not in loop] users_who_are_not_callers amount: ' + users_who_are_not_callers.length);

        // END
        return true;
    } catch (ex) {
        return false;
    }
})();]]></script_2>
        <script_3><![CDATA[success = (function() {
    try {
        // Write your script between START and END, do not change anything else
        // START

        var users_who_are_not_callers = [];
        var callers = [];

		// Get all users, who are callers on incidents
        var caller_incident_gr = new GlideRecord('incident');
        caller_incident_gr.addNotNullQuery('caller_id');
        caller_incident_gr.query();
        while (caller_incident_gr.next()) {
            callers.push(caller_incident_gr.getValue('caller_id'));
        }

		// Then get all the rest of the users
        var user_gr = new GlideRecord('sys_user');
		user_gr.addQuery('sys_id', 'NOT IN', callers)
        user_gr.query();
        while (user_gr.next()) {
            users_who_are_not_callers.push(user_gr.getUniqueValue());
        }

        gs.info('[GR not in loop, better query] users_who_are_not_callers amount: ' + users_who_are_not_callers.length);

        // END
        return true;
    } catch (ex) {
        return false;
    }
})();]]></script_3>
        <script_4><![CDATA[success = (function () {

        <script_name_2>GR not in loop, simple query</script_name_2>

if (gs.nil(number_of_scripts)) { throw Error('Missing "number_of_scripts", cannot continue'); } // Default to 10 iterations if missing from the definition var iterations = parseInt(inputs.test_definition.getValue('iterations'), 10) || 10; // Initialize variables and GlideScopedEvaluator var scripts = [], script_name = '', i = 0, glide_evaluator = new GlideScopedEvaluator(); // Loop through the selected number of scripts and also check if script is defined, start count from 1 because fields are named from _1 for (i = 1; i <= number_of_scripts; i++) { // Set a fallback value if script name is not defined script_name = inputs.test_definition.getValue('script_name_' + i) || 'script_name_' + i; // Check if the script field is empty if (gs.nil(inputs.test_definition.getValue('script_' + i))) { throw Error('Missing "script_' + i + '", cannot continue'); } // Construct the script execution objects scripts.push(new ScriptSpeedExecution(iterations, 'script_' + i, script_name)); } // Start looping through the iterations and running the scripts for (i = 0; i < iterations; i++) { scripts.forEach(function (script) { script.timer_start_time = new Date(); // Start time of script execution // Need to use GlideScopedEvaluator to run the scripts since they are passed from record and not given within this same script glide_evaluator.evaluateScript(inputs.test_definition, script.script_field_name, { success: true }); if (!glide_evaluator.getVariable('success')) { throw Error('Failed to execute script "' + script.script_name + '", check your script and retry'); } script.timer_end_time = new Date(); // End time of script execution script.elapsed_time_MS = script.timer_end_time - script.timer_start_time; // Calculate elapsed time by subtract starting value from final value script.execution_time_per_iteration.push(script.elapsed_time_MS); }); } // After all the iterations count total and average times + remove the result of the last iteration scripts.forEach(function (script) { script.total_execution_time_MS = script.get_total_elapsed_time(); script.average_time_MS = script.get_average(); delete script.elapsed_time_MS; }); outputs.script_execution_details = JSON.stringify(scripts); outputs.success = true; } catch (ex) { gs.error('Error in Flow Action "Execute Scripts":\n' + ex) outputs.success = false outputs.error_details = ex.message; } })(inputs, outputs);71aa7f6647032200b4fad7527c9a719bapplication4a1d17d647f90210edd8b4b4116d43dbnik-admin2024-04-28 20:09:52061d57d647f90210edd8b4b4116d43000nik-admin2024-04-28 20:09:52var__m_sys_flow_step_definition_input_106afb6647032200b4fad7527c9a71e7

// Initialize variables and GlideScopedEvaluator var scripts = [], script_name = '', i = 0, glide_evaluator = new GlideScopedEvaluator(); // Loop through the selected number of scripts and also check if script is defined, start count from 1 because fields are named from _1 for (i = 1; script.average_time_MS = script.get_average(); delete script.elapsed_time_MS; }); outputs.script_execution_details = JSON.stringify(scripts); outputs.success = true; } catch (ex) { gs.error('Error in Flow Action "Execute Scripts":\n' + ex) outputs.success = false outputs.error_details = ex.message;         "propertyValues": {

                "type": "TRANSLATION_LITERAL",
                "value": {
                    "code": null,
                    "comment": "",
                    "message": "<p><span style=\"font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\"><strong>About Script Speed Tester</strong></span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">The application aims at measuring how long does the particular script execute. It also has the ability to compare the speed of up to 9 scripts. The tool is useful for optimising the run time of scripts when using them in ServiceNow.</span></p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><span style=\"font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\"><strong>Contributors</strong></span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Natalia Kasper</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Niko S&auml;&auml;ski&nbsp;</span></p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Original speed test libraries - credits to <a href=\"https://github.com/R3J3NT/ServiceNow-performance-study\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Jakub</a></span></strong></p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>"
                }
            }
        },
        "slot": null,
        "styles": null
    }
]</composition><da_relay_models/><data>[

]</props><required_translations>[ {
  "message" : "<p><span style=\"font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\"><strong>About Script Speed Tester</strong></span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">The application aims at measuring how long does the particular script execute. It also has the ability to compare the speed of up to 9 scripts. The tool is useful for optimising the run time of scripts when using them in ServiceNow.</span></p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><span style=\"font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\"><strong>Contributors</strong></span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Natalia Kasper</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Niko S&auml;&auml;ski&nbsp;</span></p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Original speed test libraries - credits to <a href=\"https://github.com/R3J3NT/ServiceNow-performance-study\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Jakub</a></span></strong></p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>",
  "comment" : ""
} ]</required_translations><root_component/><root_component_config/><root_component_definition/><schema_version>1.0.0</schema_version><state_properties/><sys_class_name>sys_ux_macroponent</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>nat-admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2024-05-25 17:18:51</sys_created_on><sys_id>40e8310b47520210edd8b4b4116d43c7</sys_id><sys_mod_count>2</sys_mod_count><sys_name>Test</sys_name><sys_package display_value="Script Speed Tester" source="x_1397355_s_speed">9e1b559e47310210edd8b4b4116d4307</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="Script Speed Tester">9e1b559e47310210edd8b4b4116d4307</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sys_ux_macroponent_40e8310b47520210edd8b4b4116d43c7</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>nat-admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2024-05-25 18:32:00</sys_updated_on></sys_ux_macroponent><sys_translated_text action="delete_multiple" query="documentkey=40e8310b47520210edd8b4b4116d43c7"/></record_update>

106afb6647032200b4fad7527c9a71e7nik-admin2024-05-08 20:04:04eaab326d47420210edd8b4b4116d4363109e1b559e47310210edd8b4b4116d4307nik-admin2024-05-13 19:18:56sys_hub_step_instanceeaab326d47420210edd8b4b4116d4363400sys_variable_valuenik-admin2024-05-08 20:04:043aab326d47420210edd8b4b4116d43810nik-admin2024-05-08 20:04:0435aa573fd7802200bdbaee5b5e610375f5e56d79b3101300176b051a16a8dce4sys_hub_step_instanceeaab326d47420210edd8b4b4116d4363600sys_variable_valuenik-admin2024-05-08 20:04:04feab326d47420210edd8b4b4116d438110nik-admin2024-05-25 17:01:53(function execute(inputs, outputs) { try { var results = JSON.parse(inputs.details); // Sort the results based on the total execution speed results.sort((a, b) => a.total_execution_time_MS - b.total_execution_time_MS); var ran_by_user = inputs.test_definition.getDisplayValue('last_run_by'); // CSS styling is set in a system property var style_css = gs.getProperty('x_1397355_s_speed.result.style', ''); var html = style_css + '<container>'; html += '<div id="results_summary">Test ran by <strong>'+ ran_by_user + '</strong> at ' + inputs.test_definition.sys_updated_on; html += '<br><br>Fastest script is <strong>' + results[0].script_name + '</strong> with an average execution time of ' + results[0].average_time_MS + ' milliseconds'; html += '<br>Slowest script is <strong>' + results[results.length - 1].script_name + '</strong> with an average execution time of ' + results[results.length - 1].average_time_MS + ' milliseconds'; html += '<br><br>Scripts in order from fastest to slowest. Iterations: ' + results[0].iterations + '. Times are in milliseconds.'; html += '</div>' // Set up a result table and columns html += '<table id="results_table">'; html += '<thead>'; html += '<tr>'; html += '<th>Script</th>'; html += '<th>Script #</th>'; html += '<th>Average Time</th>'; html += '<th>Total Execution Time</th>'; html += '<th>Slower than Fastest, %</th>'; html += '<th>Execution Times</th>'; html += '</tr>'; html += '</thead>'; html += '<tbody>'; // Print the results to the table var el = {}, time_diff_to_fastest = 0, fastest_avg = results[0].average_time_MS; for (i = 0; i < results.length; i++) { el = results[i]; if (i != 0) { time_diff_to_fastest = Math.round(((el.average_time_MS - fastest_avg) / fastest_avg) * 100); }; html += '<tr>'; html += '<td>' + el.script_name + '</td>'; html += '<td>' + el.script_field_name.substring(el.script_field_name.length - 1, el.script_field_name.length) + '</td>'; html += '<td>' + el.average_time_MS + '</td>'; html += '<td>' + el.total_execution_time_MS + '</td>'; html += '<td>' + time_diff_to_fastest + '</td>'; html += '<td>' + el.execution_time_per_iteration.join(', ') + '</td>'; html += '</tr>'; } html += '</tbody>'; }; html += '<tr>'; html += '<td>' + el.script_name + '</td>'; html += '<td>' + el.script_field_name.substring(el.script_field_name.length - 1, el.script_field_name.length) + '</td>'; html += '<td>' + el.average_time_MS + '</td>'; html += '<td>' + el.total_execution_time_MS + '</td>'; html += '<td>' + time_diff_to_fastest + '</td>'; html += '<td>' + el.execution_time_per_iteration.join(', ') + '</td>'; html += '</tr>'; } html += '</tbody>'; html += '</table>'; // Include the scripts that were used html += '<br><br><div id="scripts">Scripts used:'; for (i = 1; i <= results.length; i++) { var def_gr = inputs.test_definition; html += '<pre class="script">'; html += '<span class="script_name">' + results[i - 1].script_name + '</span><br>'; html += escapeHtmlCharacters(def_gr.getValue(results[i - 1].script_field_name)); // Escape the JS characters so it won't mess up the HTML html += '</pre><br>'; } html += '</div>'; html += '</container>'; outputs.html = html; outputs.success = true; } catch (ex) { gs.error('Error in Flow Action "Write Script Test Results":\n' + ex) outputs.error_details = ex.message; outputs.success = false; } })(inputs, outputs); function escapeHtmlCharacters(script) { return script.replace(/[&<>"'`=\/]/g, function(char) { return { '&': '&', '<': '<', '>': '>', '"': '"', "'": ''', '`': '`', '=': '=', '/': '/' }[char]; }); }71aa7f6647032200b4fad7527c9a719bsys_hub_step_instancee1352e3947c24210edd8b4b4116d4392400sys_variable_valuenik-admin2024-05-09 13:04:2769352e3947c24210edd8b4b4116d43a10nik-admin2024-05-09 13:04:2735aa573fd7802200bdbaee5b5e610375f5e56d79b3101300176b051a16a8dce4applicatione1352e3947c24210edd8b4b4116d4392nik-admin2024-05-09 13:04:2725352e3947c24210edd8b4b4116d43a10nik-admin2024-05-09 13:04:27var__m_sys_flow_step_definition_input_106afb6647032200b4fad7527c9a71e7
